Title.evidence: Neurobehavioral Outcomes in Pediatric Open-Chest CPR: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This secondary analysis of the Therapeutic Hypothermia after Pediatric Cardiac Arrest In-Hospital Trial included 56 children

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess neurobehavioral outcomes one year post-arrest in children who received open-chest CPR during in-hospital cardiac arrest

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 12-month survival with VABS-II ≥70

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable

Number_Analysed.evidence: 33 (59%) survived to 12 months, and 22 (41%) survived with VABS-II decreased by ≤15 points from baseline

Result_Outcome.evidence: 33 (59%) survived to 12 months, and 22 (41%) survived with VABS-II decreased by ≤15 points from baseline

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided
